tool.name: Get-subseq
tool.description: Extract sequence for your gene IDs (entire or region) from rice genome or multiFASTA file
tool.command: #if str($reference.source) == "history": mkdir index_dir && ln -s $idList index_dir/tab && cut -f $col1 index_dir/tab > index_dir/genecol && ln -s $reference.own_fasta index_dir/tmp_genome.fa && samtools faidx index_dir/tmp_genome.fa && samtools faidx --continue --region-file index_dir/genecol index_dir/tmp_genome.fa --output '$outFasta' && rm -rf index_dir #else: mkdir index_dir && ln -s $idList index_dir/tab && cut -f $col1 index_dir/tab > index_dir/genecol && samtools faidx --continue --region-file index_dir/genecol '$reference.index.fields.path' --output '$outFasta' && rm -rf index_dir #end if

param.name: idList
param.label: Select (gene) ID/region list (tabular format)
param.help: Your gene ID list SHOULD BE (1) tabular data type and (2) present in your target sequence(s), else the tool fails!

param.name: col1
param.label: gene ID column
param.help: Select column number where your gene ID/region(s) are (if your list is a multicolumn table).

param.name: source
param.label: Will you select a multiFASTA sequence from history or use a built-in rice genome database?
param.help: Built-in genomes and genes for representative rice variety groups are included.
param.option: Use a multiFASTA from the history

param.name: index
param.label: Select reference genome
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact Rice Galaxy team!

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

param.name: index
param.label: Select reference database
param.help: If your genome of interest is not listed, contact Rice Galaxy team!

validator.message: No indexes are available for the selected input dataset

tool.help:
.. class:: infomark
**Get_subseq - what it does**
This tool extracts a subsequence of interest from important rice reference genomes (N22 - aus, IR64 - indica, Azucena - TrJ, Nipponbare - TeJ).
One use case is: you would align a query sequence to these genomes using the Find-seq tool, then extract the subsequence of choice from the alignment output using this tool.
Another case is that you specify a gene ID list file. You can also specify which region for a gene ID to extract.::
An example Nipponbare gene ID list (one ID per line) LOC_Os01g... LOC_Os04g... Another example Nipponbare rice chromosome IDs with the region indicated (one ID-region per line, following Samtools faidx format format!) Chr1:1-500 Chr5:1:2000-4000
The scaffold / chromosome /sequence name spelling is important. Pls make sure you use the correct sequence name to extract (scaffold_nn or chr0n ...).
Samtools-0.19_ is used to extract subsequences from the multiFASTA/genome file.
.. _Samtools-0.19: http://samtools.sourceforge.net/samtools.shtml
